results.adx_keywords: Colleges and Universities;Right-Wing Extremism and Alt-Right;United States Politics and Government;Accreditation;Fringe Groups and Movements;Community Colleges;Banducci, Todd;Republican Party;North Idaho College;Coeur d'Alene (Idaho)
results.title: The MAGA-fication of North Idaho College
results.abstract: G.O.P. activists set out to root out the “deep state” at home. An Idaho community college may never be the same.

media.caption: Brent Regan, right, the chairman of the Kootenai County Republican Central Committee, with Todd Banducci, a trustee for North Idaho College.
media.copyright: Margaret Albaugh for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides;Murdaugh, Alex (1968- );Murdaugh, Margaret (d 2021);Murdaugh, Paul (d 2021);South Carolina
results.title: Breaking Silence, Murdaugh Brother Says ‘Not Knowing Is the Worst Thing’
results.abstract: After Alex Murdaugh’s trial ended in a conviction for the murders of his wife and son, his older brother Randy is still trying to understand what happened that night.

media.caption: “He knows more than what he’s saying,” Randy Murdaugh said of his brother, who was convicted of murder last week. “He’s not telling the truth, in my opinion, about everything there.”

results.adx_keywords: Russian Invasion of Ukraine (2022);Defense and Military Forces;Mercenaries and Private Military Contractors;Wagner Group;Bakhmut (Ukraine);Ukraine;Russia
results.byline: By Carlotta Gall and Daniel Berehulak
results.title: Ukrainian Soldiers, Nearly Encircled, Push Russians Back
results.abstract: The battle for Bakhmut is not over — at least not yet. Ukrainian assault brigades offered Moscow a bloody reminder of that over the weekend.

media.caption: Ukrainian soldiers firing artillery rounds toward a Russian infantry position near Bakhmut on Friday.

results.adx_keywords: Comedy and Humor;Rock, Chris;Smith, Will;Smith, Jada Pinkett;Netflix Inc
results.title: Review: Chris Rock’s ‘Selective Outrage’ Strikes Back
results.abstract: A year after Will Smith slapped him at the Oscars, Rock responded fiercely in a new stand-up special, Netflix’s first experiment in live entertainment.

media.caption: Chris Rock’s new Netflix stand-up special, “Selective Outrage,” was packaged more like a major sporting event, a star-studded warm-up act to the Oscars next week.

results.adx_keywords: Aviation Accidents, Safety and Disasters;Private Aircraft;Deaths (Fatalities);Hyde, Dana;National Transportation Safety Board;Windsor Locks (Conn)
results.title: Passenger of Business Jet Is Killed in ‘Severe Turbulence’
results.abstract: Officials said that the passenger, a Maryland resident, sustained fatal injuries during the flight, which made an emergency landing in Windsor Locks, Conn.

media.caption: A Bombardier Challenger 300, like the one pictured, was forced to land in Windsor Locks, Conn., on Friday, after encountering turbulence.

results.adx_keywords: Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides;Law and Legislation;Elections, Mayors;United States Politics and Government;Local Government;Crime and Criminals;Biden, Joseph R Jr;Giuliani, Rudolph W;Lightfoot, Lori;Democratic Party
results.byline: By Gail Collins and Bret Stephens
results.title: It Would Be Foolish to Ignore What Just Happened in Chicago
results.abstract: Democratic candidates everywhere should be paying attention to the miserable showing of Lori Lightfoot in the mayoral primary.

results.adx_keywords: News and News Media;Television;United States Politics and Government;Presidential Election of 2020;Ratings (Audience Measurement);Polls and Public Opinion;Scott, Suzanne;Stirewalt, Chris;Sammon, Bill (1959- );Murdoch, Rupert;Trump, Donald J;Carlson, Tucker;Fox News Channel;Republican Party
results.title: Inside the Panic at Fox News After the 2020 Election
results.abstract: “If we hadn’t called Arizona,” said Suzanne Scott, the network’s chief executive, according to a recording reviewed by The New York Times, “our ratings would have been bigger.”

media.caption: The News Corp building in New York displays images of Fox News personalities including Bret Baier and Martha MacCallum, the pair that the network’s C.E.O. called “the face of the network”; Tucker Carlson, Laura Ingraham and Sean Hannity.

results.adx_keywords: Missing Persons;Kopta, Patricia;Pennsylvania;Puerto Rico
results.title: Pennsylvania Woman Who Disappeared in 1992 Is Found Alive in Puerto Rico
results.abstract: The family of Patricia Kopta, now 83, thought she had died years ago. They were stunned to learn that she had been on the island since at least 1999.

media.caption: Patricia Kopta was found after she shared tidbits about her past to employees at a nursing home in Puerto Rico that had been taking care of her for years.

results.adx_keywords: Electric and Hybrid Vehicles;Automobiles;Driverless and Semiautonomous Vehicles;internal-sub-only;Musk, Elon;Ford Motor Co;Tesla Motors Inc;Twitter
results.title: A 120-Year-Old Company Is Leaving Tesla in the Dust
results.abstract: Boring old Ford is proving to be a very modern company.

results.adx_keywords: Workplace Environment;Content Type: Quiz;internal-sub-only;Psychology and Psychologists
results.byline: By Emma Goldberg and Aaron Krolik
results.title: Are You a Cubicle Cat or a Couch Koala? Test Your Office Personality.
results.abstract: Personality assessment has ballooned into a giant industry that aims to explain your working style. Take our quiz to find out what kind of office creature you are.

results.adx_keywords: Whiskey;Fungi;Factories and Manufacturing;Suits and Litigation (Civil);Jack Daniel Distillery (Lynchburg, Tenn);Lincoln County (Tenn)
results.title: Whiskey Fungus Fed by Jack Daniel’s Encrusts a Tennessee Town
results.abstract: The dark growth, fed by alcohol vapors from barrels of aging Jack Daniel’s whiskey, has coated homes, cars, patio furniture and road signs in a sooty crust, residents said. One woman is suing Lincoln County.

media.caption: Whiskey fungus on tree branches in Lincoln County, Tenn. Residents have been complaining about the ethanol-fueled fungus from a Jack Daniel’s distillery in neighboring Moore County.

results.adx_keywords: Conservatism (US Politics);vis-photo;DeSantis, Ron;Trump, Donald J;Conservative Political Action Conference;Republican Party
results.byline: By Damon Winter and Jane Coaston
results.title: It Was Donald Trump’s CPAC. (No One Else Came.)
results.abstract: At the four-day conclave of MAGA conservatives, only former President Trump provided a jolt of excitement.

media.caption: An audience member at CPAC amid rows of empty seats.

results.adx_keywords: Television
results.title: ‘The Last of Us’ Season 1, Episode 8 Recap: There But for the Grace
results.abstract: This week’s episode offered a different perspective on who the good guys and bad guys of the story are. But only briefly.

media.caption: Bella Ramsey in a scene from “The Last of Us.” Ellie’s protector-in-chief may be ailing, but she’s no damsel in distress.

results.adx_keywords: Concussions;Athletics and Sports;White, Dana (1969- );TBS Network;Power Slap League
results.title: Televised Face Slapping? What Are We Becoming?
results.abstract: Slap fighting competitions have drawn the support of Dana White and Arnold Schwarzenegger, along with national TV audiences. But, our columnist writes, the so-called sport is indefensible.

media.caption: Kortney Olson was slapped unconscious in a Power Slap League bout. She now thinks competitions should not continue.
media.copyright: Bridget Bennett for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Overtime;Wages and Salaries;Labor and Jobs;Workplace Hazards and Violations;Executives and Management (Theory);Regulation and Deregulation of Industry;Law and Legislation;Fast Food Industry;Suits and Litigation (Civil);Labor Department (US);Panera Bread Company;Dunkin Donuts
results.title: You’re Now a ‘Manager.’ Forget About Overtime Pay.
results.abstract: New evidence shows that many employers are mislabeling rank-and-file workers as managers to avoid paying them overtime.

media.caption: Tiffany Palliser estimates that she worked at least 50 hours a week on average at Panera Bread, but she says she never received overtime pay.
media.copyright: Scott McIntyre for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Children and Childhood;Parenting;Families and Family Life;Child Tax Credits and Stipends;United States Politics and Government;Marriages;Romney, Mitt;Republican Party
results.title: What Republican Parents Really Want
results.abstract: How the party of family values can truly value families.

media.copyright: Illustration by The New York Times. Photographs by Getty Images

results.adx_keywords: Immigration Detention;Immigration and Emigration;Deportation;United States Politics and Government;Biden, Joseph R Jr;Mayorkas, Alejandro;Homeland Security Department;Immigration and Customs Enforcement (US)
results.byline: By Eileen Sullivan and Zolan Kanno-Youngs
results.title: U.S. Is Said to Consider Reinstating Detention of Migrant Families
results.abstract: President Biden has turned to increasingly restrictive measures as his administration prepares for the end of Title 42, which has allowed border authorities to swiftly expel migrants.

media.caption: Women and children walking inside a detention center for families in Dilley, Texas, in 2019. The practice of detaining migrant families has been fiercely debated over the past four presidential administrations.
media.copyright: Ilana Panich-Linsman for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Russian Invasion of Ukraine (2022);Bombs and Explosives;Defense and Military Forces;vis-photo;Marinka (Ukraine);Russia
results.byline: By Tyler Hicks and Marc Santora
results.title: This Is What Trench Warfare on the Front Line Is Like
results.abstract: The Ukrainian military calls it the zero position, where Russian soldiers are close enough to see, and where an old war tactic takes a horrific toll.

media.caption: Boghdan, a Ukrainian soldier, firing a rocket-propelled grenade toward Russian forces from a trench in an area of Marinka, in eastern Ukraine.

results.adx_keywords: Speedskating;Records and Achievements;Stolz, Jordan (2004- );Nuis, Kjeld (1989- );Netherlands
results.title: Vanquishing the Dutch, Jordan Stolz Creates a New Norse Myth
results.abstract: Stolz, the 18-year-old from Wisconsin, won three gold medals at the speedskating world championships, finishing his turns in a way that seemed like something out of a storybook.

media.caption: Jordan Stolz of Wisconsin on Sunday celebrated his win in the 1,500-meter race at speedskating’s world championships in the Netherlands. His best finish at the Beijing Olympics, just over a year ago, was 13th.

results.adx_keywords: Illegal Immigration;Refugees and Displaced Persons;Asylum, Right of;Politics and Government;United States International Relations;Trudeau, Justin;Biden, Joseph R Jr;Canada;Quebec Province (Canada)
results.title: Canadians Fume as Migrants Surge at Their Border
results.abstract: A surge in illegal crossings from the United States has led to calls to shut down a rural road on the Canadian border.

media.caption: Migrants from Afghanistan, Angola, Zimbabwe and other places arriving at the Roxham Road border crossing last month in Saint-Bernard-de-Lacolle, Quebec.
media.copyright: Nasuna Stuart-Ulin for The New York Times
